quote: The fear of burglars is not only the fear of being robbed, but also the fear of a sudden and unexpected clutch out of the darkness.
author: Elias Canetti

quote: Americans have an abiding belief in their ability to control reality by purely material means... airline insurance replaces the fear of death with the comforting prospect of cash.
author: Cecil Beaton

quote: I have a tendency to sabotage relationships; I have a tendency to sabotage everything. Fear of success, fear of failure, fear of being afraid. Useless, good-for-nothing thoughts.
author: Michael Buble

quote: It seems to me we have been in a rhetorical arms race in this country, with each side unwilling to lay down its weapons for fear - usually justified - the other side would beat them to a pulp.
author: Pat Sajak

quote: When you're fearful, you stumble.
author: Jenna Jameson

quote: I just don't know that shame and fear need to be our teachers; rather, compassion, understanding, and love should be our guides.
author: Kyan Douglas

quote: I like challenges, I like that fear you feel for something new, and with a new director, I think it's very important to always support new projects.
author: Kate del Castillo

quote: We are all human beings, immigrant or non-immigrant. We all feel fear. We all love and become confused when we don't act as well as we would like to. We all get depressed and have feelings of uselessness. All of these things are true and have always been true.
author: Akhil Sharma

quote: Isn't that what we come into politics for? To say to people: 'You can do it, too - there is a chance to serve your community. There is a chance to shape it co-operatively and democratically, without fear or favour.' And that is what I tried to do.
author: Joan Kirner

quote: We should not be afraid to go into a new era, to leave the old beyond.
author: Zack Wamp

quote: To fight fear, act. To increase fear - wait, put off postpone.
author: David Joseph Schwartz

quote: We consume our tomorrows fretting about our yesterdays.
author: Persius

quote: When we are afraid we ought not to occupy ourselves with endeavoring to prove that there is no danger, but in strengthening ourselves to go on in spite of the danger.
author: Hale White

quote: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there's no risk of accident for someone who's dead.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: On every front there are clear answers out there that can make this country stronger, but we're going to break through the fear and the frustration people are feeling. Our job is to make sure that even as we make progress, that we are also giving people a sense of hope and vision for the future.
author: Barack Obama

quote: Having a child, that's always been my biggest fear. I want a child and I fear a child.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: You are going to let the fear of poverty govern you life and your reward will be that you will eat, but you will not live.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: True nobility is exempt from fear.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Men walk this tightrope where any sign of weakness illicits shame, and so they're afraid to make themselves vulnerable for fear of looking weak.
author: Brene Brown

quote: It is the strange fate of man, that even in the greatest of evils the fear of the worst continues to haunt him.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I'd rather give my life than be afraid to give it.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: Neither a man nor a crowd nor a nation can be trusted to act humanely or to think sanely under the influence of a great fear.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Our Western society is showing its technological muscles in ever more threatening ways, but the experience of fear, anxiety and even despair has increased in equal proportion. Indeed, the paradox is that the powerful giants feel as powerless as a new-born babe.
author: Henri Nouwen

quote: You can't 'work through worry and fear rationally,' because fear isn't rational!
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: As a child, I was more afraid of tetanus shots than, for example, Dracula.
author: Dave Barry

quote: That might have a lot to do with it, but you know, I probably don't show fear, but I suffer from fear like everyone else.
author: Steve Irwin

quote: People who say, 'There's nothing to fear from spiders' have clearly never been to Australia.
author: Cate Blanchett

quote: In Israel, waves of anger and fear circulate all the time, but so do jokes and gossip and silky evening breezes. So, too, in America.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: The Cuban people still live in constant fear of a brutal totalitarian regime that has demonstrated time and again its utter disregard for basic human dignity. The fight for a free Cuba has gone on for far too long.
author: Mitt Romney

quote: Sleep makes people calmer, more alert, less fearful - just plain happier, or so I see around me and in me. I am sure that if this great nation were to concentrate on getting more sleep, we would be a happier, more confident people, and that by itself would be a major achievement.
author: Ben Stein

quote: He whom many fear, has himself many to fear.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: The people have nothing to fear of me; people have never feared me.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: The threat or fear of violence should not become an excuse or justification for restricting freedom of speech.
author: Alan Dershowitz

quote: Noam Chomsky has a book, which I read for the first time when I was in Spain, called 'Fear of Democracy'. There is your answer. Fear of democracy. In Honduras, they had a sham democracy. It was run by elites, what was called a liberal democracy, but in reality was a false democracy.
author: Hugo Chavez

quote: If any man has left us for fear of Nero, I shall not account him a coward; but I shall hail as a philosopher any man who has been superior to this fear, and I shall teach him all I know.
author: Apollonius of Tyana

quote: There's fear in everything, but we can't just succumb to that. We have to suppress it, so we get used to suppressing fear to make it through the our day. Otherwise, we'd become paralyzed by them.
author: Eli Roth

quote: We often pretend to fear what we really despise, and more often despise what we really fear.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: No matter what you may think about her politics or her record, Hillary Clinton understands that this is not reality television; this is reality. She understands the job of president. It involves finding solutions, not pointing fingers; and offering hope, not stoking fear.
author: Michael Bloomberg

quote: What is the benefit of fasting in our body while filling our souls with innumerable evils? He who does not play at dice, but spends his leisure otherwise, what nonsense does he not utter? What absurdities does he not listen to? Leisure without the fear of God is, for those who do not know how to use time, the teacher of wickedness.
author: Saint Basil

quote: In his State of the Union speech in January 1941, President Franklin Roosevelt declared America's commitment to Four Freedoms in the struggle against Nazi totalitarianism. Among them was the freedom from fear.
author: Robert Dallek

quote: Girls grow up scarred by caution and enter adulthood eager to shake free of their parents' worst nightmares. They still know to be wary of strangers. What they don't know is whether they have more to fear from their friends.
author: Nancy Gibbs

quote: We fear things in proportion to our ignorance of them.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: I think that my vampires in general were influenced by my being allowed to watch the Hammer vampire films. Vampire Circus, also shown as Circus of Fear, was one of those movies.
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

quote: Death threatens our speech with futility because death is not just a biological event - it is a reality we fear may rob our living of any significance.
author: Stanley Hauerwas

quote: The human longings that are deep inside of us never go away. They exist across cultures; they exist throughout life. When people were first made, our deepest longing was to know and be known. And after the Fall, when we all got weird, it's still our deepest longing - but it's now also our deepest fear.
author: John Ortberg

quote: I think most models fear growing old, but from a tender age I had always chosen to play someone grown up. I am slowly but surely catching up with the people that I have spent the last decade and a half trying to portray.
author: Erin O'Connor

quote: I love the unknown. I think because it brings fear, and to embrace fear is the best feeling.
author: Juliette Binoche

quote: I have a fear of being broke. That's what I have a fear of. I'm not kidding.
author: Loni Love

quote: I always say three things make a writer: inspiration, obviously; perspiration, doing the work. But the third is desperation. I'm not really fit for anything else, or to have a real job. That fear drives me. The pressure has always been self inflicted.
author: Harlan Coben

quote: Imagine how wicked society would be if the fear of God and the fear of civil law were both completely removed.
author: Ray Comfort

quote: My feelings for Ellen overrode all of my fear about being out as a lesbian. I had to be with her, and I just figured I'd deal with the other stuff later.
author: Portia de Rossi

quote: Show me a guy who's afraid to look bad, and I'll show you a guy you can beat every time.
author: Lou Brock

quote: I still get thrilled by the energy that is a live performance, the fear and the panic and the electricity that happens on the night. I think jolting myself every once in a while with that fear is a good thing for me.
author: Jane Krakowski

quote: The creation of God itself, I deduced, came from our primal fear.
author: Kamal Haasan

quote: Film critics said I gave a voice to the fear we all have: that we'll reach a certain point in our lives, look around and realize that all the things we said we'd do and become will never come to be - and that we're ordinary.
author: Ann Bancroft

quote: Hate is the consequence of fear; we fear something before we hate it; a child who fears noises becomes a man who hates noise.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: From fear to bonding with the audience to getting more open - that's what standup is. It humanises you.
author: Maysoon Zayid

quote: I'd love to work with Aaron Sorkin on something. Just the way he writes, he has no fear in writing people that are fiercely intelligent, and I love that.
author: David Tennant

quote: Cyclops, that's like this primal fear. I had dreams for years that the Cyclops was a small creature living in our huge fish tank at home, and at night, it was going to grow to full size and come after me.
author: Henry Selick

quote: My first novel, 'The Lions of Lucerne,' just poured out of me. It was an amazing feeling of accomplishment. My biggest fear and therefore my biggest obstacle to becoming an author had been, 'What if I spend all that time and the book is no good?'
author: Brad Thor

quote: There is nothing that fear and hope does not permit men to do.
author: Luc de Clapiers

quote: Don't fear your mortality, because it is this very mortality that gives meaning and depth and poignancy to all the days that will be granted to you.
author: Paul Tsongas

quote: Fear is the main factor in Arab politics... There is no Arab who is not harmed by Jews' entry into Palestine.
author: Moshe Sharett

quote: One thing about being successful is that I stopped being afraid of dying. Once you're a star you're dead already. You're embalmed.
author: Dustin Hoffman

quote: I get afraid of the dark if I'm in a great deal of dark, and I have to move around inside of that fear... But there is a chance that something... will talk to me from the dark, so I have... to be prepared for that communication, which has happened.
author: Emil Ferris

quote: While your life is the true expression of your faith, whom can you fear?
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: Extremism in defense of liberty is not a vice, but I denounce political extremism, of the left or the right, based on duplicity, falsehood, fear, violence and threats when they endanger liberty.
author: George W. Romney

quote: I'll play a happy character, but most characters are driven by a pain or a fear. They are driven by something deep down, and most people are like that in the sense. And so, that's what interests me.
author: Emory Cohen

quote: If you let your fear of consequence prevent you from following your deepest instinct, your life will be safe, expedient and thin.
author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quote: God, make me so uncomfortable that I will do the very thing I fear.
author: Ruby Dee

quote: What will it profit this country if we... put our man on the Moon by 1970 and at the same time you can't walk down Woodward Avenue in this city without fear of some violence?
author: Jerome Cavanagh

quote: You want to know why there's a Texas Rangers? Well, here's the answer. You know how the six-gun came around? Well, here's the answer. You want to know why Mexicans allowed Americans to settle Texas in the first place? It was fear of Comanches.
author: S. C. Gwynne

quote: The generality of men are naturally apt to be swayed by fear rather than reverence, and to refrain from evil rather because of the punishment that it brings than because of its own foulness.
author: Aristotle

quote: The problem is not getting rid of fear, but using it properly.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: Everyone wishes that the man whom he fears would perish.
author: Ovid

quote: Minds that are ill at ease are agitated by both hope and fear.
author: Ovid

quote: Fear makes us feel our humanity.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The thirst for powerful sensations takes the upper hand both over fear and over compassion for the grief of others.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: There is no passion so contagious as that of fear.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: I fear the Greeks, even when they bring gifts.
author: Virgil

quote: The fearful unbelief is unbelief in yourself.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The thinner the ice, the more anxious is everyone to see whether it will bear.
author: Josh Billings

quote: We have perhaps a natural fear of ends. We would rather be always on the way than arrive. Given the means, we hang on to them and often forget the ends.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Fear is exciting for me.
author: Ayrton Senna

quote: When desire dies, fear is born.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: My parents, products of the Great Depression, were successful people, but lived in a state of constant fear that my sister and I, and they, would sink into the kind of economic insecurity that their generation knew so well.
author: Ben Stein

quote: We lavish on animals the love we are afraid to show to people. They might not return it; or worse, they might.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: An ugly sight, a man who is afraid.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Why is it that when we get older, we get more fearful?
author: Sandra Bullock

quote: I have a fear of being boring.
author: Christian Bale

quote: I'm different, and my manner invites questions. I'm never afraid to answer.
author: Marlee Matlin

quote: A company is stronger if it is bound by love rather than by fear.
author: Herb Kelleher

quote: Grief has limits, whereas apprehension has none. For we grieve only for what we know has happened, but we fear all that possibly may happen.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: The unknown used to be really scary, just that fear of, 'What's next? What if I'm not prepared?' I just don't feel that way anymore. I feel like the best is yet to come.
author: Mandy Moore

quote: The mark of fear is not easily removed.
author: Ernest Gaines

quote: Courage is a peculiar kind of fear.
author: Charles Kennedy

quote: Our biggest fear is that 'Food, Inc.' will move heavy-handed food-safety regulations forward.
author: Joel Salatin

quote: You can't be afraid to put out a fire if you're a fireman. You can't be afraid to be a police officer and carry a gun if you're afraid to get up and go out there. So you've got to put that fear to the side and go out in faith to overcome that.
author: Duane Chapman

quote: You know, sometimes I feel well and vital in the world, and sometimes I just feel so distressed I want to pull my hair out by the roots.
author: Sharon Stone

quote: Sometimes, we feel like we don't want to offend people, but there are times that we need to express ourselves without fear that somebody is going to shut us down simply because we have differing opinions. That's how we grow.
author: Benjamin Watson

quote: My biggest fear as a fighter is to be knocked out in front of millions of people. But after it actually happened, there's this calmness about you that says everything is OK.
author: Eddie Alvarez

quote: So then learn to conquer your fear. This is the only art we have to master nowadays: to look at things without fear, and to fearlessly do right.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: Fear of the unknown is a terrible fear.
author: Joan D. Vinge

quote: Nostalgia is eternal for Americans. We are often displaced from our origins and carry anxious memories of that lost past. We fear losing our bearings.
author: Gregory Benford

quote: I have an irrational fear that something bad is going to happen to me when I'm drinking out of a water fountain. I have no idea why.
author: Andrew Luck

quote: I think everyone shares a fear of failure - that you're only as good as your most recent collection. That's definitely a fear, but it's a fear that fuels me, that makes me want to work harder, that makes me take on more challenges.
author: Alexander Wang

quote: I have a dreadful fear that the more you try to prevent revealing the self, the more you do.
author: A. S. Byatt

quote: No one should have to live in fear.
author: Jeff Fortenberry

quote: American economists can't understand the German fear of inflation and the effects of inflation when dealing with the world economic crisis. They wonder why Germany pursues such a different course - 'Why can't they agree with us?' I would have thought it was fairly obvious.
author: Simon Rattle

quote: Few revolutions succeed, and when they do, you often discover they did not gain what you hoped for, and you condemn yourself to perpetual fear, as the parties you defeated may always regain power and work for your ruin.
author: Francesco Guicciardini

quote: As repressed sadists are supposed to become policemen or butchers so those with an irrational fear of life become publishers.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Humble souls are fearful of their own strength.
author: William Gurnall

quote: I was a very fearful little kid, and I would always see the worst in everything. The glass was half-empty. I would see people kissing, and I would think one was trying to bite the other.
author: Daniel Clowes

quote: Let the fear of danger be a spur to prevent it; he that fears not, gives advantage to the danger.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: With such thoughts in your mind, now that you have resolved to love Him and please Him with all your strength, your only fear should be to fear God too much and to place too little confidence in Him.
author: Alphonsus Liguori

quote: What we have most to fear is failure of the heart.
author: Sonia Johnson

quote: I've always had a problem saying what I feel for fear of having someone dislike me.
author: Sandra Dee

quote: His advice to me is basically to just love what you do and don't let the fear of failure stop you.
author: Oliver Hudson

quote: I hasten to laugh at everything, for fear of being obliged to weep.
author: Pierre Beaumarchais

quote: Don't let your fear paralyze you. Prepare yourself not only technically, but also emotionally.
author: Bob Weinstein

quote: I think what weakens people most is fear of wasting their strength.
author: Etty Hillesum

quote: I am convinced that it is not the fear of death, of our lives ending that haunts our sleep so much as the fear... that as far as the world is concerned, we might as well never have lived.
author: Harold Kushner
